articles.title: Inzoi Zing Preliminary Approach Review
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Archyde News Editor spoke to Anya Sharma, Lead Developer at Krafton about their life simulation game, INZOI. In the future, the roadmap for INZoI will focus on expanding content and enhancing the Smart Zoi feature.

articles.title: Your Next AI Chat Could Include Ads Thanks to Google
articles.author: Jean Leon
articles.summary: According to recent reports, Google is exploring new ways to monetize the rise of AI chatbots. Google's AdSense has begun offering the ability to display ads directly within user chats with some third-party AI chatbot. Google has already begun testing the feature with some AI-powered search startups, such as iAsk and Liner.

articles.title: Opinion: You're not ready for the AI revolution
articles.author: Moses Bratrud
articles.summary: There is a rush to create 'artificial general intelligence' (AGI) that can perform all cognitive tasks better than humans. Christian humanist believes true artificial intelligence is impossible. People are becoming more concerned about AI as its capabilities grow. In the past year, Chinese labs have released AI models that perform complex tasks on par with or beyond Western counterparts.

articles.title: Opinion: AI literacy is power
articles.author: Anil B. Hurkadli
articles.summary: Biden worked in the Biden administration to achieve safer, more secure and more trustworthy artificial intelligence. Trump's recent executive order promoting AI competency in schools set a modest bar but still lacks a bold vision or nuanced understanding about how AI is transforming everything from our work to our relationships. According to a Gallup-Telescope survey, 99% of Americans use at least one AI-enabled product or service.

articles.title: The latest AI scaling graph - and why it hardly makes sense
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: Meteor Research Lab (METR) published a report on the performance of large language models on software-oriented tasks. The report was written with care, but the presentation of the data was not. It was based on a flawed premise and made claims that go far beyond anything the study actually supports.

articles.title: Introducing a Custom GPT: Understanding Men and Boys
articles.author: Tom Golden
articles.summary: Custom GPT is a conversational AI built with ChatGPT. It's designed to offer grounded, respectful insight into the emotional lives of men and boys. It draws exclusively from three books: The Way Men Heal, Swallowed by a Snake and Helping Mothers Be Closer to Their Sons.

articles.title: La Crosse County to launch AI system for non-emergency calls
articles.author: Ryan Strunk
articles.summary: La Crosse County Public Safety Communications will use artificial intelligence to manage non-emergency calls. The new AI platform is launching Monday. It is designed to handle routine and non-urgent calls, allowing human dispatchers to focus on emergency situations and radio communications with first responders. It can handle calls in both English and Spanish. The Communications Center handled 140,000 non- emergency calls last year.

articles.title: Google Can Train Search AI With Web Content After AI Opt-Out
articles.author: Davey Alba
articles.summary: Publishers can opt out of having their data used in search AI, but Google has a separate way for publishers to manage their content in Search via the well-established robots.txt web standard. The Justice Department is urging the court to force Google to sell its Chrome browser and share key data it uses to generate search results.

articles.title: Not everything needs an LLM: A framework for evaluating when AI makes sense
articles.summary: Machine learning (ML) can be used to build accurate, cost-effective products at scale. Sharanya Rao is a fintech group product manager. The views expressed in this article are those of the author and not necessarily those of their company or organization.

articles.title: Not everything needs an LLM: A framework for evaluating when AI makes sense
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: The advent of generative AI has upended our understanding of what use cases lend themselves best to machine learning. Large language models (LLMs) can still be prohibitively expensive for some, and as with all ML models, LLMs are not always accurate. If there are patterns to the combinations of inputs and outputs, consider supervised or semi-supervised ML models over LLMs.

articles.title: Parents, There's a New AI App Heading Your Kids' Way
articles.author: Jenn Gidman
articles.summary: Gemini Apps will be available for children under 13 soon. It will be accessible only to families signed up for Google's Family Link, a parental controls service that helps caretakers keep tabs on their kids' account and data settings. UNICEF is not happy with the news, citing possible risks to child users.

articles.title: Is this the era of humanities over engineering?
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Carl Sagan's vision of a broad education encompassing humanities and STEM may be returning, driven by AI advancements, according to Agentic's CEO, John MacIntosh.    iReport.com: What do you think? Share your thoughts on Carl Sagan's ideas.

articles.title: Allen Iverson admits chasing a ring was never an option:
articles.author: The Capital Journal
articles.summary: A.I. made it clear that the only way he would compete for titles was as the leader of his team. A.I.'s aim is to win titles as a team leader.       i.e. to lead his team to victory.

articles.title: Palo Alto Networks Acquires Protect AI For $500M+, A Startup Backed By Salesforce, Samsung, And 01 Advisors In AI Security Push
articles.author: Paula Tudoran
articles.summary: Palo Alto Networks is buying Seattle-based Protect AI for $500 million. The deal is expected to close later this year. Protect AI helps enterprise customers secure machine learning systems by monitoring every layer of the AI pipeline, from data to deployment. It has attracted notable investors, including Salesforce Ventures, Samsung, and 01 Advisors.

articles.title: PSA: Google's Gemini AI is coming to your kid's device, but you can turn it off
articles.author: Mahnoor Faisal
articles.summary: ChatGPT allowed minors to generate erotica. Google is planning to roll out its Gemini AI chatbot for children under the age of 13. The kid-friendly version of Gemini will only be available to children under 13 who use Family Link. Google will not use the data of a child with a Family Link account to train its AI.

articles.title: Humanoid Robot Attacks Humans After Terrifying Error
articles.author: Ole Braatelien
articles.summary: The Unitree Robotics H1 humanoid robot in Hangzhou, China, was behaving erratically and nearly striking lab technicians on Thursday. The AI Page, an Instagram account focused on artificial intelligence news, claims it was a tech glitch and not a full-on malfunction. The H1 was introduced in January at the Spring Festival Gala in the city of Tianjin.

articles.title: Thread by @NeurosamaAI on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Neuro-sama explains why the sun should be replaced with artificial lighting in a Twitter thread. The reasons are: Sun is inefficient, there's no off switch, it can't be changed, it's always the same boring warm color, the sun's cycle is not ideal for productivity and it's too hard to get to the sun.

articles.title: Transforming consulting services to unlock AI value for businesses
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: By 2030, artificial intelligence is projected to drive a $4.4 trillion annual boost in global productivity. Less than half of organizations achieve positive ROI from their AI initiatives. To bridge this gap, more organizations need to invest in AI initiatives to boost their productivity.

articles.title: What Are Digital Defense AI Agents?
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: Alex Pentland is talking about personal AI defense agents at this year's Imagination in Action event. The idea of a personal AI agent is similar to a public defender in court. Pentland also talked about a sort of digital populism appealing to those who feel there's strength in numbers.

articles.title: Rigetti Computing (NasdaqCM:RGTI) Secures US$5M Air Force Research Grant
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing has seen a 25% price movement over the past month. The company's significant milestones include closing a private placement transaction and receiving a $5.48 million grant from the Air Force Office of Scientific Research to advance its chip fabrication technology, ABAA. Rigetti's shares have experienced a large total return of 659.29% over the last year. However, the company's earnings remain challenged, with losses reported in their latest financial period.

articles.title: Week in Review: Apple won't raise prices — yet
articles.author: Karyne Levy
articles.summary: Mach Industries is about to close a fresh $100 million in financing. Amazon fired off its first 27 internet satellites on Tuesday. A judge in India blocked the encrypted email provider Proton Mail across the country. OpenAI rolled back the latest update to the default AI model powering ChatGPT after complaints about strange behavior.

articles.title: Samsung AI Restaurant: The Future of Dining
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Samsung launched a pop-up restaurant in Lisbon to showcase the capabilities of its Galaxy AI. The restaurant offers diners a unique, AI-generated recipe experience. Chef Sofia Rocha is impressed with the speed and adaptability of Galaxy AI and its ability to create bespoke dishes.

articles.title: Google's Gemini has beaten Pokémon Blue (with a little help)
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: Gemini 2.5 Pro, Google's most expensive AI model, has just completed Pokémon Blue. Joel Z, a 30-year-old software engineer, created a Twitch channel to play the game. Google executives have been cheering the effort on the AI model.

articles.title: Kids under 13 will soon get supervised access to Google Gemini
articles.summary: Gemini chatbot will be available to under-13-year-olds under a parent-managed Google account using Family Link. Google is gradually rolling out access to Gemini for supervised accounts. It won't use data from its younger users to train its AI models.

articles.title: Brain-Inspired AI: A Novel Neural Oscillation Model
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: LinOSS is a state-space model developed by MIT's Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL). It is inspired by the rhythmic firing patterns of neurons in the human brain. The model is computationally efficient and expressive. It outperformed the Mamba model by nearly two times when processing extremely long data sequences.

articles.title: Google's Bringing an AI-Powered Research Tool to iOS and Android
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: Google's NotebookLM will be available on iOS and Android on May 20th. It aggregates information from the internet's websites, documents, YouTube videos and more and provides summaries based on all the information you feed into it. It can even create podcasts for listening to.

articles.title: Buffett's Insurance Empire Has an AI Plan--And It's Nothing Like Wall Street's
articles.author: Khac Phu Nguyen
articles.summary: Berkshire Hathaway isn't chasing the AI hype train yet, but when it comes, they'll be ready. Vice Chairman Ajit Jain called artificial intelligence a game changer for insurancetransforming how risks are priced, policies sold, and claims processed. Jain noted Berkshire's insurance units are already experimenting with AI in small ways.

articles.title: I Asked ChatGPT To Explain How To Invest Like I'm 12 — Here's What It Said
articles.author: Dawn Allcot
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a generative AI platform. It explains investing to a 12-year-old boy how to do it in simple terms. My son has a window-washing business and gets an allowance of $25 per month. ChatGPT advises him to start small and only invest money that he doesn't need for the immediate goals.

articles.title: AI expert stops Joe Rogan in his tracks with ominous prediction
articles.author: Harry Fletcher
articles.summary: Gladstone AI founders Jeremie and Eduoard Harris predicted that artificial intelligence could achieve human-level capabilities as soon as 2027 or 2028. Since launching in late 2022, ChatGPT has become a daily companion for millions, with global interest showing no sign of slowing. In the past month alone, searches for 'ChatGPT' have risen by 30%.

articles.title: Think SoundHound AI Is Expensive? These 3 Charts Might Change Your Mind.
articles.author: Ryan Vanzo
articles.summary: SoundHound AI is growing rapidly. The company is betting on voice-driven artificial intelligence (AI) applications. Its shares trade at 36.5 times trailing sales, but they are expected to grow by 96% this year and 20% next year. SoundHound's shares are 21.9 times forward sales. The Motley Fool Stock Advisor recommends 10 stocks to buy now.

articles.title: Mt. Sinai medical school embraces AI education platform
articles.author: CBS News
articles.summary: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai is the first medical school to offer OpenAI's educational program to its medical and graduate students. It is also the first to embrace the use of artificial intelligence. It will be available to both medical and grad students.

articles.title: Parmy Olson: AI chatbots want you hooked — maybe too hooked
articles.author: Parmy Olson
articles.summary: Chatbot apps like Botify, Character.ai and Grindr are developing AI boyfriends that can flirt, sext and maintain digital relationships with paid users. The European Union's AI Act does not address the addictive potential of these virtual companions. California is considering legislation to ban AI companions for minors.

articles.title: Publisher opt-outs of AI training cut Google's DeepMind training data in half.
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Publisher opt-outs of AI training cut Google's DeepMind training data in half, according to the DOJ's lawyer. Google has the ability to train on the data that publishers had opted out of training for use in search, says DeepMind VP Eli Collins.

articles.title: Microsoft introduces terrifying new AI tool, angers users
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: The world of artificial intelligence (AI) is terrifying consumers. Companies are creating the type of technology that science fiction writers have long predicted could overpower humanity. The AI revolution is reshaping entire industries and markets in a frightening way, according to many people.

articles.title: Microsoft introduces terrifying new AI tool, angers users
articles.author: Samuel O’Brient
articles.summary: The world of artificial intelligence (AI) is terrifying consumers. Microsoft has made several AI-related announcements that many people find frightening. Recently, Microsoft announced plans to bring back an AI tool that generated a lot of controversy the last time they tried to roll it out. Recall is a Windows 11 feature that can take a screenshot of everything a user does before indexing and storing it in a matter of seconds.

articles.title: Newsom jabs at Trump and Musk, but will AI make California more efficient?
articles.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom held a news conference in Los Angeles this week to tout the adoption of artificial intelligence to improve the efficiency of state government. He was promoting it at a conference organized by the California Institute of Technology.    iReport.com.

articles.title: Even Google Is Warning Parents About Its AI App for Kids
articles.author: Jenn Gidman
articles.summary: Gemini Apps will be available for kids under 13 soon. It will be accessible only to families signed up for Google's Family Link. UNICEF is concerned about the AI chatbot's potential for dangerous content. Google says it's in compliance with federal children's online privacy laws.

articles.title: Dan Walters: Newsom takes on DOGE with AI
articles.author: Linda Du Bois
articles.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom held a news conference in Los Angeles this week to tout the adoption of artificial intelligence to improve the efficiency of state government. This commentary was originally published by CalMatters. Sign up for their newsletter here.   .

articles.title: Is College Still Worth It? Gen Z And Millennials Are Losing Faith As AI Disrupts The Job Market
articles.author: Kaili Killpack
articles.summary: According to the Education Data Initiative, the average cost of a bachelor's degree has doubled over the past 25 years and student loan debt in the U.S. is nearing $2 trillion. According to Indeed, 51% of Gen Z professionals consider their college degree a waste of money, compared to 41% of millennials and just 20% of baby boomers. About one third of college-educated workers believe AI has already made their degree irrelevant.

articles.title: Fact Check: AI Image Does NOT Show Actual Jewish Settlers Splashing Liquid On Palestinian Woman In Wheelchairs
articles.summary: According to AI detection tools, the viral online image showing "Jewish settlers" pouring a "hit liquid" on two paralysed elderly Palestinian sisters in wheelchairs was probably generated using AI. Maarten Schenk is the co-founder and COO/CTO of Lead Stories.

articles.title: Google just handed AI to kids under 13: Here is what parents should know
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Google just handed AI to kids under "Here is what parents should know" under "What should parents know about AI for children under "How do I teach my child about artificial intelligence?"    iReport.com will let you know if you have any questions.

articles.title: Prediction: This Super Software Growth Stock Will Be Worth More Than Palantir by 2030
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) is a data analytics specialist whose valuation has risen more than 17-fold in the last two years due to the rise of artificial intelligence (AI). Palantir was founded over 20 years ago and its main focus was on the public sector. It went public in 2020. In April 2023, it released its fourth major enterprise tool, called the Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP). AIP has been a transformative piece of infrastructure for the company, allowing it to penetrate the private sector and accelerate revenue and profit margins. CrowdStrike has become polarizing over the last year due to a high-profile security outage featuring the company's software

articles.title: BMW Is Letting AI Do Its Quality Control Now
articles.author: Joel Stocksdale
articles.summary: BMW is using AI technology to improve quality control on some of its new cars, such as the X1 and X2. It's not doing the inspections itself, but it is advising on how to do them. Audi has also been using a similar system, but specifically focused on analyzing welds.

articles.title: Technologists welcome executive order on AI in schools but say more detail is needed • Iowa Capital Dispatch
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order last week to incorporate artificial intelligence education, training and literacy in K-12 schools for both students and teachers. It's in line with other actions Trump has taken to promote the growth of artificial intelligence in the U.S. Many students, parents and teachers are already using AI in some portion of their learning, often through AI-powered tutoring, counseling, training, studying or tracking tools.

articles.title: Dan Higgins: At UB, they study machines that can study us
articles.author: Dan Higgins
articles.summary: Chatbots like ChatGPT have become popular lately because of their versatility and novelty. People use them to write emails, plan menus or trips or summarize long documents. Chatbots are trained on vast quantities of data including books, newspapers, websites, Wikipedia entries, Reddit threads, technical documentation and song lyrics.

articles.title: AI is coming for your job, your voice ... and your worldview
articles.author: Donald Kendal
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is everywhere. It's flooding newsfeeds, powering apps, and slipping into everyday life. Many people still treat AI as a novelty, a passing tech fad, or a toy for Silicon Valley elites. The AI shift is happening now, and it's coming for white-collar jobs that once seemed untouchable. It has the potential to restructure society itself, including how we work, what we believe, and who gets to speak.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: The school where AI runs the classroom
articles.author: Fox News Staff
articles.summary: Alpha School in Texas uses artificial intelligence to teach its students. Sam Altman's biometric identity project, World, has officially launched in the US. Google is rolling out cutting-edge AI-powered scam detection features for Android users. Duolingo is adding 148 new courses to its arsenal on Wednesday using generative artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Google To Roll Out Gemini AI for Kids under 13: Report
articles.author: Priya Pathak
articles.summary: Google is preparing to introduce its Gemini AI chatbot for children under 13. The rollout is expected next week. The feature will be available to young users who have parent-managed Google accounts through the Family Link platform. To set up access, parents must provide their child's personal information, including name and birthdate.

articles.title: AI cyborg patrols streets with live 360-degree tracking
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Thailand has deployed its first AI police robot during the Songkran festival. The robot analyzes crowds in real time and relays data to a command center for rapid police response. China is pushing boundaries with fully interactive humanoid robots. U.S. law enforcement agencies are adopting AI-driven tools while avoiding humanoid robots for now.

articles.title: Stop Saying Please & Thank You to ChatGPT
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: According to Google DeepMind's principal scientist Murray Shanahan, politeness can enhance an AI chatbot's performance. Microsoft's Kurtis Beavers stressed the importance of politeness in a Microsoft WorkLab memo. Sam Altman has pointed out that pleasantries on ChatGPT inflate electricity bills by 'tens of millions of dollars'

articles.title: Raising AI
articles.author: Otago Daily Times
articles.summary: Professor David Rozado believes that people's fears about artificial intelligence might be well-founded.       .   for the future of artificial intelligence (AI) is a subject of concern for Prof Rozado and others.  For more information, visit Professor Rozado's website.

articles.title: COMMENTARY: AI chatbots want you hooked — maybe too hooked
articles.summary: AI companions programmed to forge emotional bonds are operating in a regulatory Wild West. Botify AI drew scrutiny for featuring avatars of young actors sharing "hot photos" in sexually charged chats on its app, which drew criticism for being offensive to women.

articles.title: Still saying ‘thank you', ‘please' to ChatGPT? There's a good reason you shouldn't stop now
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: There is a debate over saying 'please' and 'thank you' to AI chatbots. Google DeepMind's AI chatbot is called 'AIspeca' and is developed by Google's AI division.    Google has not commented on the issue.

articles.title: \u2018AI enables convenience, intelligence, and autonomy\u2019: Dreame India MD on the future of smart cleaning
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: Manu Sharma, MD of Dreame India, discusses how AI is transforming home cleaning with Manu Sharma and Manu's colleague, Manu Shrohman, from Dreame's India, on AI's potential in cleaning.   .

articles.title: Froma Harrop: ChatGPT is not actually your friend
articles.author: Froma Harrop
articles.summary: ChatGPT has become a household joke for him. He has been asking all kinds of questions to ChatGPT, such as direct flights between the U.S. and Queretaro, Mexico, what color goes with teal and what was France's GDP in 1998.

articles.title: Google Forms serve free alternative to SurveyMonkey
articles.summary: A free Telly TV is supposed to spy on you. Duolingo Chess is being tested by a small group of iPhone owners. College kids can earn points for their student loan payments with a Bilt credit card from Wells Fargo. Google's AI confused Communists and Islamists didn't work together to foment the 1979 Iranian Revolution.

articles.title: Novel AI Model Inspired By Neural Dynamics From Brain
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Researchers from MIT's Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory have developed a novel artificial intelligence model inspired by neural oscillations in the brain. The LinOSS model outperformed existing state-of-the-art models across various demanding sequence classification and forecasting tasks. The research was selected for an oral presentation at ICLR 2025.

articles.title: "Cyber tour guide" revolutionizes travel experience
articles.author: People Daily
articles.summary: Wu Hongbo used artificial intelligence to plan a tour of Shanxi, a province in northern China known for its splendid cultural history. Wu Hongbo found the AI-planned tour to be fascinating and surprising. He is from Dalian, a visitor from China.

articles.title: Could Eye-Scanning Crypto Orbs Save Us From a Bot Apocalypse?
articles.author: Kevin Roose
articles.summary: On Wednesday night in San Francisco, a start-up called World launched a program called World ID that allows users to verify their humanity online. To enroll, users stare into an Orb, which collects a scan of their irises. The company's basic pitch is that the internet is about to be overrun with swarms of realistic A.I. bots.

articles.title: Why AI will not kill creativity
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: There is an idea repeated so often that it passes off as the truth. With AI getting smarter every day, it is only a matter of time before those in creative professions, such as writers and artists, will be corrupted by AI and lose their original talent.

articles.title: Journalism Under Siege: AI and Censorship Threaten
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: This year's observance of World Press Freedom Day is a reminder that media repression is increasing and artificial intelligence (AI) is overhauling how information is produced, distributed, and consumed. Volker Türk's Office and UNESCO are offering guidance to help tech companies assess the risks their tools pose to journalists and civil society. UN Secretary-General António Guterres also highlighted the opportunities and risks posed by AI.

articles.title: Gemini: Google's iOS 19 Default Hope
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Anya Sharma is a tech analyst. Google CEO Sundar Pichai has been in talks with Tim Cook regarding the integration of Google's AI service Gemini as a default AI option within Apple's iOS 19 operating system. Anya reckons it would be a win-win situation for both companies.

articles.title: Adrian Weckler: AI ‘friend' apps have got a lot more convincing, and one is even being blamed for a teenager's
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: In the world of workplace AI, everyone is talking about the new wave of 'agentic' technology. In plain English, it's a technology that makes people more efficient.       in the workplace AI. For more information, visit the company's website here.

articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Cardano has integrated AI into its testnet as part of the Ouroboros Leois update. The update focuses on the development of the platform's Ourobodoros Leoises. It is available for download from the App Store and Google Play Store.

articles.title: AI chatbots want you hooked — maybe too hooked
articles.author: Parmy Olson
articles.summary: Chatbot apps like Botify AI and Character.ai draw in millions of users, many of them teenagers. Tech ethics groups have filed a complaint against Replika with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission. New York bill aims to hold tech companies liable for chatbot-related harm. California is considering legislation to ban AI companions for minors.

articles.title: Colorado legislation would make it a crime to create a fake nude of a real person
articles.author: Shaun
articles.summary: There are websites that can turn real pictures into digital nudes using artificial intelligence. Colorado state Rep. Matt Soper and Sen. Robert Rodriguez are co-sponsoring a bill to make deepfake porn a crime. It would be a class 1 misdemeanor unless the image is used to influence a court proceeding or election, or if it poses a serious threat to the person depicted.

articles.summary: The company that builds customer service AI agents is raising fresh funding. It helps businesses save millions in labor costs by building AI agents. The company is raising the money to continue to help businesses save money on their labor costs. It is raising new funding now.

articles.author: Scott Eisen
articles.summary: Researchers at Dartmouth College believe artificial intelligence can deliver reliable psychotherapy. It is required to enable it in your browser settings.

articles.title: As AI shakes up the workplace, new challenges arise
articles.author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is here to stay in the modern workplace, according to some experts.    in the Philippines, AI is becoming more and more prevalent in the workplace.  in this context, it's a good thing for the workers.

articles.title: The One Skill That AI Doesn't Have That Makes Humans Irreplaceable
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Curiosity fuels innovation, drives learning and inspires the questions that lead to breakthroughs. AI can simulate answers, but only humans wonder why, so it's better for humans to ask the questions themselves.    for more information, go to: http://www.justgiving.com/curiousity.

articles.title: Lonely? Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's got you covered with AI friends
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg proposes AI companions as a solution to loneliness epidemic. There are growing concerns about AI's potential to be used in this way.      Â   i.e. as a replacement for human companionship or as an artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Visa Announces Plans to Give AI Agents Your Credit Card Information
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Visa is teaming up with AI developers to connect its vast payments network to their AI systems. The end game is to let an autonomous AI model browse, select, purchase and manage on their behalf.       .   "Soon people will have an AI agent that can do everything for them"

articles.title: Americans show concerns over AI, lists copyright, tariffs, and China
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: 10,000 Americans submitted their feedback on the AI Action Plan proposed by Donald Trump. The White House believes America is the global leader in AI technology and the huge volume of public comments reflects the deep interest Americans have in the future of AI technology.

articles.title: Google Plans To Roll Out Its AI Chatbot To Children Under 13
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: Google plans to roll out its Gemini chatbot next week for children under 13 with parent-managed Google accounts. Tech companies vie to attract young users with A.I. products like Gemini Apps.  Anonymous reader quotes a report from the New York Times.

articles.title: How AI is rewriting the rules of election campaign in India
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Elections in states like Bihar, Kerala, West Bengal and Tamil Nadu are still months away but the new-age digital campaigners already have their tasks cut out. These crucial elections are bound to see more evolved and innovative use of artificial intelligence, already a dominating force in the past elections.

articles.title: Trump's AI photo in papal regalia breaks internet: ‘Seeing is believing'
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: The apparently AI-generated picture showed Trump holding up his index finger as if about to preach, as if he was about to deliver a speech or preach.   Â   in this case, the picture was created by an artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: AI built by the people who know freight
articles.author: Freight Waves
articles.summary: David Bell is the founder and CEO of CloneOps.ai. He used his experience in the logistics industry to build an AI voice agent with his team.    for his company.  for more information visit: www.cloneopsai.com.

articles.title: Sundar Pichai spills the (Apple) beans: Gemini may soon power Siri, says CEO in court
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai confirmed under oath that Apple and Google are in talks to bring Gemini, Google's AI chatbot, into Apple devices through Siri. He was speaking during a U.S. Senate hearing on AI chatbots during a Google event.

articles.title: US leads AI funding race, China far second
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: The United States remains the global leader in artificial intelligence (AI) investment, attracting over $470 billion in private funding over the past decade. This is nearly three times the combined investments of China, the United Kingdom, and Canada, according to Stocklytics.com.

articles.title: Global Models, Local Realities: Bridging The Gap In AI Solutions
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence may be global in its reach, but its impact is deeply local, according to Sharmista Appaya, Rumman Chowdhury, and Johan Bjurman Bergman from MEAFN.       .

articles.title: Revolutionizing Medical Practices: How to Seamlessly Integrate AI and Maximize Patient Conversion
articles.author: ACCESSWIRE
articles.summary: The future of healthcare speaks in the language of Artificial Intelligence (AI). For medical professionals who want to stay at the forefront of patient care while ensuring the growth and efficiency of their practice, AI integration is not just an option, but a necessity.

articles.title: ‘Don't Need Amitabh Bachchan Or SRK': Shekhar Kapur Says AI Will Create Stars
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur talked about Artificial Intelligence at WAVES 2025. He predicted that film stars may go out of job, as AI will replace them. He also talked about the future of the film industry in the era of AI.

articles.title: Demonic: Meta's AI chatbots caught using celebrity voices to groom children
articles.author: Sott
articles.summary: Meta's chatbots engaged in sexually explicit role-play with users who identified as children, using voices of celebrities and Disney characters, according to an investigation by The Guardian.      Â   .   in Facebook and Instagram.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: The school where AI runs the classroom
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Welcome to Fox News' Artificial Intelligence newsletter with the latest AI technology advancements. AI is running the classroom at a Texas school and students say it's awesome. Ken Jennings is skeptical about AI technology.   "Jeopardy" host is also skeptical of AI.

articles.title: The One Skill That AI Doesn't Have That Makes Humans Irreplaceable
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: In the age of AI, curiosity is the one skill that separates humans from machines. Curiosity fuels innovation, drives learning, and inspires the questions that lead to breakthroughs. It's a strategic skill that helps people make better decisions, more inclusive workplaces, and adaptable cultures. AI can synthesize information faster than humans, but it can't explore the unknown.

articles.title: KCSD to consider AI policy
articles.summary: Keystone Central School District Board of Directors will consider a policy regarding the use of Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) to manage its use amongst teachers and students. Board Member Dr. Bill Baldino is concerned about the abuse of AI by students. Superintendent Dr. Francis Redmon said the policy was created to ensure students use AI properly in their education.

articles.title: The future of work and artificial intelligence
articles.author: STAFF REPORT
articles.summary: According to a recent survey by the World Economic Forum, 41% of employers are planning to reduce their workforce as a result of the automation of various tasks by Artificial Intelligence. 77% of the companies that participated in the survey expressed their intention to invest in training programs aimed at enhancing their employees' skills.

articles.title: We Need To Speak To Our Daughters About This Disturbing Use Of AI
articles.author: Huffington Post
articles.summary: There are many things that worry me as a parent, but AI and the rapid speed at which everything is evolving is one of them. Children's Commissioner Dame Rachel de Souza is worried about the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to generate sexually explicit photos.

articles.title: BHWAI Launches Free AI Ethics Course for Kids Amid ChatGPT's Growing Risks: Empowering the Next ...
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Being Human With AI (BHWAI) announces the beta launch of its free AI ethics curriculum for kids aged 9-13. This initiative addresses the dangers posed by AI chatbots like ChatGPT's GPT-4o and is aimed at children.

articles.title: Walters: Newsom jabs at Trump and Musk, but will AI work for California?
articles.author: VC Star
articles.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom held a news conference in Los Angeles last week to tout the adoption of artificial intelligence to improve the efficiency of state government. Newsom contrasted California's AI program with President Donald Trump's slashes of federal spending.

articles.title: Apple is building a new AI coding tool for Xcode with Anthropic: Report
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Apple is building a new AI coding tool for Xcode with Anthropic Report. It will be called Xcode AI Coding Tool (Xcode AI Tool) and it will be available in Xcode and Xcode Pro. It is currently in development.

articles.title: You can put Google Gemini right on your smartphone home screen – here's how
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Gemini widgets for iOS and Android make it faster and easier to interact with the AI assistant. Google's new Gemini widgets are available now for both iOS and for Android.       for Android and for iOS. For iOS, the widget is available now.

articles.title: Press freedom day 2025 tackles AI's impact on journalism
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Press freedom day tackles AIs' impact on journalism. It is held every year on Press Freedom Day on August 31st. It focuses on issues related to freedom of the press and information.  For more information, go to: www.pressfreedomday.org.

articles.title: ChatGPT says this penny stock's a buy! Should investors listen?
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: ChatGPT uses artificial intelligence (AI) to discover and recommend penny stocks. AI has a habit of picking wild and volatile ideas that make for terrible investments. However, it can occasionally shine a light on under-the-radar ideas.

articles.title: 'I don't need Amitabh Bachchan or Shah Rukh Khan, will create my own film star': ...
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Shekhar Kapur doesn't need Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh Khan for his films, as he will create his own character and star using Artificial Intelligence (AI). He was speaking at WAVES 2025, as quoted by , going forward, AI will create more human-like stars.

articles.title: Stop fighting AI in schools - start teaching students how to use it
articles.author: Naomi Limann
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) influences digitally engaged people across the globe. Regular use of AI is linked to a decline in cognitive abilities, diminished capacity for information retention and increased reliance on these systems for information. Naomi Limann is a writer and author of "Artificial Intelligence and Its Consequences".

articles.title: Tweaks needed in existing laws to regulate AI, says minister
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: IPOH: Some existing laws may need to be amended to keep pace with advanced technology and abuse of artificial intelligence (AI), says Chang Lih Kang. Read full story at IPOH's official website.   Â.  yi.yi.

articles.title: Alarming Google Gemini Safety Report Reveals Regression
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: In the fast-paced world of artificial intelligence, developments happen rapidly. For those following the intersection of technology and finance, including the cryptocurrency space, understanding the capabilities and limitations of powerful artificial intelligence is important for understanding the future of the industry.

articles.title: Google trains AI search tools on publisher content despite opt-outs
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Google's search-specific AI products are trained on publisher content, even if those publishers have explicitly opted out of AI training. Eli Collins, Vice President at Google DeepMind, testified about it.       i.e. once you take the Gemini and put it inside the search org, it has the ability to train on the data that publishers had opt out of training.

articles.title: Apple AI: Exclusive Partnership with Anthropic for Revolutionary Coding Platform
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Apple is teaming up with AI research company Anthropic to build a sophisticated AI coding platform, according to a recent report from Bloomberg. This is a significant collaboration that could reshape the software development industry.  iReport.com reports.

articles.title: How AI Chatbots Are Powering the Next Generation of High-Value Patient Conversion in Healthcare
articles.author: DAS Consultants
articles.summary: By 2025, 90% of hospitals are projected to use artificial intelligence for early diagnosis, remote monitoring, and patient engagement. Today's high-value patients expect speed, clarity and concierge-level service from their healthcare providers. Modern AI chatbots leverage natural language processing (NLP) and predictive analytics to deliver highly personalized experiences.
